boardgame.name: Siren's Song
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Siren's Song, a 4th level adventure for Aphelion's Gate: A Science Fiction Roleplaying Game, which introduces the Gamemaster and Players to The Galaxy of alien worlds and adventure. The Eridani Strain uses the D10 Pentra System, of which only a 10-sided die is needed to play this RPG adventure.

Galaxy Tours and Resorts has received a strange message from its resort on the moon Shravania Prime. A foreboding missive is hidden within the communication by the resort's staff. Stay away, it states, as the tourists have been infected by something unknown and have taken over the resort. Vacation time is over! So strap on your force screen, grab your laser pistol, concentrate on your Psi, prepare your starship for Hypershot, and blast off from Aphelion’s Gate!

The Aphelion's Gate INTRO rules can be used to play most of this adventure, though the CORE rules are needed to enjoy this entire adventure.
boardgame.rpg: Aphelion's Gate: A Science Fiction Roleplaying Game

boardgame.name: Scarlock Hill (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

With slick black fingers, the muddy soil grasps at your heels as you laboriously climb Scarlock Hill’s rock-strewn slope. A hundred feet below, scores of tall pine trees silently watch your ascent. Against the scarlet backdrop of the setting sun, they resemble dark jagged towers rising from an ocean of boiling fog, and for a brief moment it almost seems as if you’ve crossed into another world.

A gentle but cold breeze picks up, eliciting timid whispers from the shivering shrubs of rose haw, urging you to turn back while you still can. You’ve all but reached the top now. One by one, the great standing stones crowning the ancient barrow mound hove into view: a perfect circle of eight megaliths surrounding a cracked altar stone. A lone crow perches on the nearest menhir. Pecking and scratching at the stone, it caws a final warning in the black language of its kind before flying off, leaving you alone atop Scarlock Hill.

This Dungeon Backdrop is designed to work with the Lonely Coast campaign setting but can be easily inserted into almost any fantasy campaign.

boardgame.name: Casper (1995)
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

In this world, when one dies without proper resolution, with ‘unfinished business’, they become ghosts. One ghost, Casper, is desperate for a friend, receiving little other than abuse from his uncles, Stinkie, Stretch, and Fatso: The Ghostly Trio. Should events proceed as normal, Casper’s haunt, Whipstaff Manor, will fall under the ownership of one Carrigan Crittenden. Believing the manor to house a secret treasure, Carrigan will set in motion a course of events that may yet lead Casper to finding a true friend.

You arrive in this world about an hour before Nicky and Andreas, two young boys, break into Whipstaff Manor on a dare.

boardgame.name: Hellsing
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

It is the end of the 20th century and as they always have, strange things move in the darkness beyond the sight of mankind. Humanity is not alone in this world nor is it the apex predator it sees itself as. Monsters prey on us, demons that run the gamut from vampire to werewolf to stranger things still. Even humanity itself can sometimes become it’s own demon, our own sins and ambitions driving us to become worse than an inhuman being could ever hope to be. The humanity that sets us apart allows us to fall the furthest.

boardgame.name: Wild, Wild West
boardgame.description:
Come manage a town in the West they said, it’ll be thrills, spills, and chills they said. Well, friends, they weren’t wrong. It has been that and more. But boy howdy, the disasters keep popping up! Almost as those someone is out to see your town fail and their town succeed!

Each turn players are rolling dice, but some of those dice don’t help your town! In fact, they hinder it! From bringing Varmints into town and luring bandits, it’s a right cow poke in the eye!

Your success can be large too though! Just look at that cash you can grab from selling watered down liquor at twice the price to filling up a train for a sight-seeing ride! You’ll even have the chance to round up some notorious Wanted Outlaws and put them back behind bars where they belong! Get your head of cattle together, tell those Varmints to scram, and let’s have us a good ol fashion ho-down!

Players are encouraged to look back over their town and share stories of their skilful mismanagement of certain areas. Does your town have a lot of high priced hooch and an ineffectual legal system? Do your future residents from the train feel safe knowing the Varmints have been rehomed? What about those outlaws, did you shut them down quickly with swift legal justice?

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Super-Skill Pinball: Ramp it Up!
boardgame.description:
Super-Skill Pinball: Ramp it Up! is a standalone sequel to Super-Skill Pinball: 4-Cade that you can play solo, with up to four people in a single box, or with even more people with multiple copies. To play, choose one of the four unique tables and matching backglass for scorekeeping, then roll a shared pair of dice and get the pinballs rolling! You'll select one of the two die results, then move your pinball to a bumper or spinner, or target one level below with a matching number. Once you reach the lowest level, pick which flipper's roll to use to send the ball right back to the top. Play well, and you'll unlock bonuses like multiball, score multipliers, and more to help you get the high score!

Super-Skill Pinball: Ramp it Up! features these four new tables:


Gofer Gold introduces the new extra flipper and provides a great starting point for new players! Strike it rich by panning for gold, or ride Fool's Folly into the backglass where you ride the log flume, search the lost mine, and navigate the falls!
In Pin Pals, wrestlers enter the ring in tag-teams of two, each teammate with a slightly different table. As you play, you activate bonuses for each other and build extra multipliers when you enter the cage together. Coordination is key if you want to beat the high score!
High Roller Heist packs all the action of a classic casino caper into two rounds, making it one of the fastest tables in Super-Skill Pinball! Recruit your crew, choose your target, and execute your plan without getting caught by security! Includes three different possible targets for your heist, each represented by a unique backglass mini-game.
Top Speed turns your pinball into a race car and opens up an all-new challenge for experienced players with adjustable speed! Add 1, 2, or 3 to your dice rolls, building big numbers and even bigger bonuses — but if you go too fast, the flippers won't be able to stop you!

boardgame.name: Other Minds (Issue 24 - Jan 2021)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Almost perfectly on schedule, Other Minds Magazine, Issue 24 has been published.

Inside its 77 pages, you will find the following content:

Editorial: Some ramblings of your editor about the current Issue and other related stuff.
The Road Goes Ever On: What is out there on our favourite topic.
Inside Information: Some news (recent and not-so-recent) on Middle-earth gaming and lore topics.
Blood in the Waters: A short adventure for a beginner's comapny set in Rhovanion.
Fourth Age of Middle-earth: A short outline for developing the histories of the Fourth Age.
Ravens and Crows: Some thoughts about how Tolkien developed these birds for Middle-earth plus a suggested in-world background for it.
TOR Guide to the Lands of Lindon: A brief overview of Lindon and its people for use with TOR.
The Sisters and the Sea: A short story about the adventures of three Hobbit sisters beyond the borders of the Shire.
The Haunted Lake - A Shire Adventure: A short Hobbit-centric adventure in Eriador, north of the Shire.
Of Ghosts and Goblins: A short and more light-hearted adventure in Rhovanion, suited as a short interlude.
A Mass Abduction: The first adventure for the 'Ravens in the North' campaign as outlined in Issue #23.
boardgame.rpgartist: José Enrique Vacas de la Rosa

boardgame.name: Gemhammer Grimoire
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

For the first time in the hands of the public, Gemhammer and Sons presents to you the Gemhammer Grimoire, spell book and personal journal of our founder, the late, great Gurin Gemhammer. His notes and research on Mana, Spells, Magic Items, and more can now be yours. His sons and their editorial team have made sure to provide additional context and details to help even novice mages get the most out of this manual of magical wonders. After all, magical education was one of Gurin’s many passions. As Gurin himself once said, “No you may not read from my Grimoire! Now get out of my office before I turn you into a platypus.”

The Gemhammer Grimoire is a book all about magical mysteries. In its pages you’ll find New Spells, Epic Spellcasting, Epic Level Spells, Exotic Spellcasting Components, Magic Feats, New Subclasses for Spellcasters, Magic Items, and more, all with that Gemhammer charm you’ve come to expect.

boardgame.name: 18Chesapeake: Off the Rails
boardgame.description:
This is an expansion (a contraction really!) for 18Chesapeake, an 18xx game. It reduces the number of trains and replaces the stock market to produce a fast and wild version of the game.

This expansion requires 18Chesapeake to play.

Includes

Stock market board
Bank pool mat
Alternate $1100 D-trains
Rule sheet

-description from publisher's website

listing.notes:
Includes: - 18Chesapeake - Off the Rails
Box was opened to condense the expansion into the base game box, but is otherwise brand new.

boardgame.name: Zulu Skirmish
boardgame.description:
Voted Best Table Top Rule Set in 2020 by Texas Toy Soldier Historical Gamers!

Zulu Game Rules for Miniatures. "Zulu Skirmish" is all about you as a "Battalion Commander" or "Zulu Ibutho" directing your Table Top forces in small unit actions. The forces under your Command consist of yourself and one or more subordinate Company or Impi Commanders and their Units.

"Zulu" is designed for 28mm figures or smaller. While fun to play with two to four Units on a side, Zulu plays great at "Tournament" or "Grand Scale Skirmish" level for those that like six or even more Units in their Table Top Army. With Commander and Unit Cards its also quick to learn so it’s a good choice for a quick “pick up” or Convention Gaming.

texas-games.com
- Free Zulu Card Set.
Includes Command Action as well as Commander and Unit Cards in PDF. Designed to Streamline Table Top Bookkeeping.

- Rule Set in Hard Bound or PDF

- Game Markers / Tokens available

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Vampire: The Masquerade – Parliament of Knives
boardgame.description: The games are text-based, and involve the player creating and customizing a character, and making choices that affect the direction of the plot. In Night Road, the player takes the role of a courier delivering secrets for vampire elders in the Southwestern United States; in Out for Blood, they take the role of a vampire hunter who protects their town; and in Parliament of Knives, the player takes the role of a vampire navigating vampire politics following a coup in Ottawa, Canada.

In Night Road, the player takes the role of a courier delivering secrets for vampire elders in the Southwestern United States; in Out for Blood, they take the role of a vampire hunter who protects their town; and in Parliament of Knives, the player takes the role of a vampire navigating vampire politics following a coup in Ottawa, Canada.

boardgame.name: Vampire: The Masquerade – Night Road
boardgame.description: The games are text-based, and involve the player creating and customizing a character, and making choices that affect the direction of the plot. In Night Road, the player takes the role of a courier delivering secrets for vampire elders in the Southwestern United States; in Out for Blood, they take the role of a vampire hunter who protects their town; and in Parliament of Knives, the player takes the role of a vampire navigating vampire politics following a coup in Ottawa, Canada.

boardgame.name: Vampire: The Masquerade Battle Royale
boardgame.description: The game is a battle royale game set in the streets and on the rooftops in Prague, in the World of Darkness.

boardgame.name: Mage: The Ascension – Refuge
World of Darkness Prelude: Mage
boardgame.description: Mage follows a volunteer in a refugee camp, who learns that magic is real and that they can use it.

boardgame.name: Vampire: The Masquerade – We Eat Blood
World of Darkness Prelude: Vampire
boardgame.description: Vampire follows a fledgling vampire who communicates with one of their friends through text message conversations

boardgame.name: Wraith: The Oblivion – The Orpheus Device
boardgame.description: The story sees the player take the role of an investigator who communicates with dead spirits to learn how they died.

boardgame.name: World of Darkness
World of Darkness Online
boardgame.description: MMO
boardgame.videogamepublisher: CCP Games / CCP hf (Crowd Control Productions)
boardgame.videogamedeveloper: CCP Games / CCP hf (Crowd Control Productions)

boardgame.name: Mage: The Ascension
boardgame.description: Announced in April 1998, with the developers still looking for a publisher and distributor by 1999. The game's official website had been taken down by 2001.

boardgame.name: Land Creatures of Planet Archipelago
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A 99 page PDF file of more than 90 creatures found on the land areas of planet Archipelago. Some are useful, some are valuable and some are dangerous, even deadly. A great supplement for any game-master.
boardgame.rpg: Planet Archipelago: A Medieval Science Fiction Role-Play Game

boardgame.name: Cançons de l'Antàrtida
Songs from Antarctica
boardgame.description:
When the autumn comes and ice gets thicker, the emperor penguins go inland to mate. After partnering, the female lays one single egg. Worn out by the effort of laying the egg, the penguin mothers set out to sea to regain her strength and nourish, while the father takes care of the egg during the cold Antarctic winter.

About two and a half months later, the chicks will be born, hungry, waiting for their mother, who brings food, while their fathers provide them with heat. Soon the mothers will arrive with their belly full of fish, that will be used to feed their chicks. The fathers will now be able to run to the sea to feed after about for months of fasting.

This game is setted up at this point, where the mothers are arriving in large columns from the ocean to find their partners and chicks and feed the young and let the manes run for the fish.

To represent that, we will have a big pile of "father and chick" cards at the center of the table (grouped together to avoid the cold of the antarctica), and each player will have a bunch of "mother penguin" cards. To recognize each other, the penguins sing the songs they sang during the mating. So, to pair the couples, you will have to find which ones are singing the same song (this is: they have the same notes with the same order and color). The twist here, is that to simulate the chaos of the mothers arriving, every player will be looking for the matches at the same time in the central pile of cards!

The first player to match all his/her mothers with the partners and chicks, will win the game!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Werewolf: The Apocalypse (2005)
boardgame.description: A werewolf-themed follow-up to Vampire: The Masquerade – Bloodlines. Produced as a playable prototype following the completion of Bloodlines.

boardgame.name: My Maid Girlfriend
My Maid Girlfriend: Romance You Choose
boardgame.description:
User Summary

After your dad discovers an oil deposit your life changes from ordinary to millionar. As your father leaves on a business trip he hires three maids to take care of you - all show up to be your childhood friends Ana, Mina and Kim.

boardgame.name: Something's Fishy
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mini-Dungeon adventure for five characters of levels 9–11

Ernesto Santiago owns a small curio shop quayside called Santiago’s Curiosities. He often buys the trinkets and treasures sailors discover out there, content with going nowhere fast.

Unbeknownst to Santiago, a seemingly harmless jade statue he purchased about a month ago was possessed by a servitor of Dagon. The entity began whispering telepathically to Santiago, planting the idea for an overdue career change—to go-getter cult leader and hydra-breeder. Now, his shop’s basement is flooded, hosting a fledgling cult of Dagon, with more inhuman followers arriving by the day.

Unfortunately for Santiago, the strumpet he recently captured in his shop turned out to be a noble’s wife, slumming incognito among the rabble. And said noble’s pockets are deep enough to afford investigators to track his wife, and the services of adventurers to get her out of any cinch...

boardgame.name: Cathedral of the Sword
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In a glorious sunlit autumnal ruin rests the Sword!

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 30 x 30 map depicting a ruined cathedral in an autumnal forest, the resting place of a powerful artefact

boardgame.name: My Strange Girlfriend
boardgame.description:
User Summary

You take a summer job as a cottage caretaker between high school and collage; the job pays well, it's easy enough and there are also living three beautiful girls - each with their secrets...

boardgame.name: Monsters of the Week #01: Léviathan sous roches
Smell a Leviathan
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The docks, autumn’s mist.
A warehouse has been forced. The content of a crate is missing and there are 2 bodies too much :
a guard and maybe one of the thieves.
Their skulls have been open and hollowed out, the corpses are soaked and spongious…
Here starts a game of cat and mouse between you, a well established cult and the local mob !


Les docks, la brume d’automne.

Un entrepôt a été forcé. Il manque le contenu d’une caisse et il y a 2 cadavres supplémentaires : un gardien et certainement un des voleurs.

Leur crâne a été ouvert et vidé de sa substance, les cadavres sont trempés et spongieux…
C’est le début d’un jeu du chat et de la souris entre vous, un culte bien implanté et la mafia locale !

boardgame.name: The Domain
Monsters of the Week #02: Le Domaine
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

You wake up in a morbid forest.
Vague memories come back to you : screams, fear, a light…
Who are you, who are the peoples with you and what’s in the cave ?


Vous vous réveillez dans une forêt morbide.
Des souvenirs vagues vous reviennent : des cris, la peur, une lumière…
Qui êtes-vous, qui sont les gens avec vous et qu’y a-t-il dans la cave ?

boardgame.name: Runes of Zun: Action Packed
boardgame.description:
With the release of Runes of Zun, house-rules and modifications seem to be a natural direction for many players. Have you ever wanted to play the game without healing? Can you defeat each other if there are no Attack cards? What would happen if you just stuck another dozen and a half more actions into the base deck?

This expansion contains additional copies of action cards to play with. It's like a game mod kit. With it, you can mix in more cards to the game your own.

This Runes of Zun expansion works a bit like a “side deck” in other strategy card games or “house rules” for classic board games. Everyone has favorite cards, but with the Action Packed Expansion, you can test out crazy deck ideas. Mix up and swap out cards from the play deck, or find out just how chaotic the game can get!

-description from publisher's website

Includes the following cards:


4 Attack
2 Daze
2 Expose
2 Scramble
2 Steal
1 Banish
1 Defend
1 Revive
3 Restore

boardgame.name: Vie et mort d'une épave
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Petite ville portuaire, nuit de tempête.

Un bateau arrive au port, toute lumière éteinte. C’est seulement lorsqu’il heurte le béton du quai que les 2 employés de nuit le remarquent.

Lorsqu'un des gardes disparait dans ses entrailles rouillées, ils contactent les autorités compétentes… Vous.

"Vie et mort d'une épave" est un oneshot d'horreur/action, rapide à lire et facile à prendre en main, adaptable pour tout système de jeu et univers !


Translation courtesy of Google:

Small port town, stormy night.

A boat arrives at the port, all lights off. It was only when he hit the concrete of the dock that the 2 night workers noticed him.

When one of the guards disappears into his rusty bowels, they contact the appropriate authorities ... You.

" Life and death of a wreck" is a oneshot of horror / share ,
quick to read and easy to learn, adaptable for any game system and universe!

boardgame.name: Le Sarcophage Saint-Claire
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

France, année 20, une petite ville de campagne.

En rénovant un manoir, des ouvriers découvrent une étrange momie et son Sarcophage.
Entre les objets intriguant de la momie et les disparitions sur le chantier,

la propriétaire des lieux fait appel à un vieil ami antiquaire et ses associés : vous !

"Le sarcophage Saint-Claire" est un oneshot 'horreur/enquête,
rapide à lire et facile à prendre en main, adaptable pour tout système de jeu et univers !


Translation courtesy of Google:

France, year 20, a small country town.

While renovating a mansion, workers discover a strange mummy and its Sarcophagus.
Between the intriguing objects of the mummy and the disappearances on the site,

the owner of the premises calls on an old friend who is an antique dealer and his associates: you!

" The St. Clair sarcophagus" is a oneshot of horror / investigation , quick to read and easy to learn, adaptable for any game system and universe!

boardgame.name: Runes of Zun: Promo Card Set 1
boardgame.description:
A set of rare and powerful cards for Runes of Zun. Each card is designed to make gameplay a little crazy. Include one, two, or all three in your Runes of Zun deck to spice up your game. You can even add multiple copies of the three cards – play your way!

“Wild Magic” is unpredictable

Use it as an Action, Reaction, or Modifier – your choice. Draw until you reach the type of card you want and play it. Be careful, though! You have to declare your target first, so you might get unexpected results. You might help an opponent or do harm to yourself.

“Decree” forces all players to do as you do

Raise or lower everyone's HP. Force everyone to draw or discard a card. By the way, this card can be boosted. So imagine making everyone lose 3 HP instead of just 1!

“Anarchy” lets you bend the rules

All players may ignore modifier restrictions on all cards! This card stays on the table until the next time the discards are shuffled into a new deck. Anarchy opens the door for some creative and insane card interactions and combos.

Note: The Kickstarter version has a star on the cards that identify them as from the Kickstarter. Second printing doesn’t.

boardgame.name: Runes of Zun: Shadow Tactics
boardgame.description:
The Shadow Tactics Expansion will transform how you play Runes of Zun. There are five new action types (good and bad), a new reaction type, and a new and unique modifier type. Mix them into your original game for a total of 78 cards. If you also mix in the original Action Packed Expansion you'll get a total of 96 cards in your deck! New tactics will emerge and game-changing combos will win out. Are you ready?

New action cards:


Curse (x1): takes away 1 HP at the start of each of the target's turns but whoever targets the player next becomes cursed.
Slow (x2): prevents the target from playing more than one action card.
Punish (x3): deal 1 HP damage to a player for every ongoing card affecting them.
Stash (x2): hide a card from your hand for later use by you or another player.
Purge (x2): remove ongoing effects like Defend or Slow and even works against Banish


New reaction card:

Fizzle (x3): prevent an action from targeting you and forces the targeter to discard a card.


New modifier card:

Misdirect (x2): play an action and have another player suffer any consequences.


Also includes 2 extra Boost cards and 1 extra Reserve card.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Hivernation
boardgame.description:
Hivernation is a two-player, tabletop strategy game based on actual bee behaviour. Every year, just before winter, hives around the world kick out all the Drone bees so that the Workers and the Queen can survive through the winter and come back strong in the spring. The game is based on this.

In Hivernation, two players (or two teams of two players) receive a stack of 20 double sided, hexagonal bee tiles (one side Workers, one side Drones) as well as 3 specialty tiles chosen at random (or, for fairness, 2 flower tiles and 1 bear tile).

The Queen Zizi Tile is placed in the center of the play space and players take turns playing tiles from their stack. They can attach to Queen Zizi or their own bees but not directly to their opponents bees. When the two sides meet, each player, on their turn, can start converting their opponents tiles to their own by sandwiching their opponents tiles between two of their own and flipping the tiles in between to show the opposite side. There are opportunities to flip tiles in multiple directions at once as well. When a player does this they've made a multi-directional play and they're awarded another specialty tiles chosen from the stack at random.

Or they can modify game play by using one of those specialty tiles to flip tiles in a ring, stop tiles from being flipped or removing them from the game completely. The winner is the player with more of their tiles face up when the first player runs out of bee tiles to play.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Trashed
boardgame.description:
Trashed was inspired by the old-time favorite card game Garbage. With custom cards and unique twists to gameplay, Trashed takes the classic game to a whole new level. Your goal is to get your cards lined up in the right order, from 1 to 10. But, look out for the terrible Trashed card! Wild cards allow for excitingly big turns, while Stop cards will stop you in your tracks.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Words Over Easy
boardgame.description:
How do you like your words? Over easy, of course! Pop the Letter Eggs into the Egg Sorter to see which letters you can use to spell words. Letter Eggs that fall into the green side are good, while Letter Eggs that land on the red side are rotten. Players scramble to come up with words using all the letters, face-up, on the “good eggs” and none of the letters from the “rotten eggs”. Great for word game players of all ages, so get cracking!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: My Vampire Girlfriend
My Vampire Girlfriend: Romance You Choose
boardgame.description:
User Summary

You have heard rumours about an urban legend about vampires where you study, and though it is only urban legends mysterious things have happened around you and three beautiful girls from your school, and you are all four dragged into it...

boardgame.name: Hula-Hoo!
Hula-Hula
¡Hula-Hula!
呼拉大師
boardgame.description:
Animals from around the world are gathering for the hula hoop championships. Their goal is to keep up the hoop for as long as possible.

This is represented by cards. The goal is to get rid of all of your cards; or make all other players drop out ("drop their hoop").
Each player starts with five cards in their hand, plus five cards openly in front of them. When it's their turn, they can choose to play one of their open cards or one from their hand. The first player plays any card and demands the next player to play "higher" or "lower". A player can follow this, or "double" - play the same card as the player before them. Then everyone has to double (or break the double with a neighboring card or a joker. A player who cannot play drops their hoop and is out of the round.

When only one player is left, or when one player has gotten rid of all their cards, they get as many cards as have been played in that round. First player to reach 77 points wins the game.

boardgame.name: Teen Titans GO! Mayhem
boardgame.description:
The Teen Titans fight amongst themselves in Teen Titans GO! Mayhem, with each team racing to be the first to collect 5 victory points (VP).

Teen Titans GO! Mayhem is built around the "Mayhem System", a system for character vs. character team-based combat in which the most direct method for a team to gain VP is by KOing their opponents. Characters use items and powers to battle the enemy team, with battle damage changing each round based on the mayhem die. All of the Titans have a power that directly attacks their opponents, either through an attack or through fire tokens. Fire tokens deal damage equal to the mayhem die, just like a regular attack, but deal their damage at the beginning of each round.

When a character is KOed, they are removed from the board and their opponent gains VPs, with the KOed character returning to play next round.

When you're not fighting, you use teamwork to complete missions from the special GO! deck for a chance to gain VPs.

boardgame.name: Looney Tunes Mayhem
boardgame.description:
Teams of toons square off in Looney Tunes Mayhem, each racing to be the first team to collect 5 victory points (VP).

Looney Tunes Mayhem is built around the "Mayhem System", a system for character vs. character team-based combat in which the most direct method for a team to gain VP is by KOing their opponents. Characters use items and powers to battle the enemy team, with battle damage changing each round based on the mayhem die. When a character is KOed, they are removed from the board and their opponent gains VPs, with the KOed character returning to play next round.

When you're not fighting, you might be able to gain VPs from classic cartoon locations. The "Poker Stars" location, for example, allows a toon that moves onto it to try their luck; if you roll a star on the mayhem die, your team collects a VP immediately. The "Home Sweet Home" location gives your team a VP the first time both characters from your team arrive there. The "Desert Road" location gives out ACME deliveries, providing characters with additional effects to make their opponents go KABOOM!

boardgame.name: Horseman's Chess
boardgame.description:
Horseman's Chess is a chess variant in which a piece’s movement capabilities can change during play. The primary actors are the familiar chess pieces (Pawn, Rook, Knight, Bishop, Queen, and King) with their traditional movement capabilities except that none of them can move more than two spaces nor jump spaces without assistance.

Pieces augment their movement by using mounts. The Charger mount allows a piece to move an unlimited number of spaces, while the Jumper mount allows a piece to jump over an intermediate space when moving two spaces.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: My Father's Work
Le Secret de mon Père
boardgame.description:
The walls were lined with iron shelves, each metal slat overfilled with glass jars containing formaldehyde and grotesque curiosities within. Pristine brass tools and refined metals of a quality I had never before laid eyes upon were strewn across sturdy slabs of rock and wood, their edges sharp with use. However, my eyes were soon drawn to a sturdy writing desk, its mahogany eaves inlaid with thin strips of copper, the center of which contained a well-worn leather-bound book. My father's journal — passed down to me and representing years of knowledge and countless experiments. And inside that weathered tome, atop the pearly parchment oxidized yellow at its frayed edges, were the deliberate quill marks of a crazed genius outlining the ambitious project he could never complete in one lifetime — his masterwork.

Without realizing it, my hands were shaking as I clutched the book to my chest. At once, I felt an ownership and anxiety for the scientific sketches scrawled so eloquently on those frayed sheets. It was at that moment that I began my obsession: I would restore this laboratory to its former brilliance and dedicate my life to completing my father's work!

In My Father's Work, players are competing mad scientists entrusted with a page from their father's journal and a large estate in which to perform their devious experiments. Players earn points by completing experiments, aiding the town in its endeavors, upgrading their macabre estates, and hopefully completing their father's masterwork.

But they have to balance study and active experimentation because at the end of each generation, all of their experiments and resources are lost to time until their child begins again with only the "Journaled Knowledge and Estate" they have willed to them — and since the game is played over the course of three generations, it is inevitable that the players will rouse the townsfolk to form angry mobs or spiral into insanity from the ethically dubious works they have created. The player with the most points at the end of three generations wins and becomes the most revered, feared, ingenious scientist the world has ever known!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Wero Mai
boardgame.description:
Wero Mai is a Māori board game intended for students and those at a beginner level in Te Reo Māori.

It involves four different categories (New Zealand Places, Māori Culture, Flora & Fauna, Everyday knowledge) to test the player's Māori knowledge and will extend their learning so they can apply that knowledge in their everyday life.

The game aims to answer three cards per category correctly in Māori. Players can change the aim from one to three cards depending on their level or time restriction.

Wero Mai's game includes challenges which are the Taniwha and the Niho Taniwha. When the participants land on the Niho Taniwha, they must go to the nearest Taniwha. To escape the Taniwha and continue their Wero Mai journey, they need to roll an even number.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Sunrise Safari
boardgame.description:
Includes 16 animal dice, 20 large challenge cards, 4 safari cruiser dice holder cards, Meeka Meerkat squeaker, and multilingual instructional guide
Flip a challenge card. Then all players roll their animal dice in a race to match the 4 animals on the challenge card
The first to make the matches grabs the meerkat squeezer and collects the challenge card. Collect the most challenge cards to win!
Based on the best-selling even-steven's odd game

boardgame.name: A Mars terraformálása: Árész-expedíció
Mars: Teraformace – Expedice Ares
Teraformiranje Marsa: Ekspedicija Ares
Terraformacja Marsa: Ekspedycja Ares
Terraformarea Planetei Marte: Expeditia Ares
Terraforming Mars: Ares Expeditie
Terraforming Mars: Ares Expedition
Terraforming Mars: Expedição Ares
Terraforming Mars: Expedición Ares
Terraforming Mars: Expédition Arès
Покорение Марса: Экспедиция "Арес"
Тераформування Марса. Експедиція Арес
テラフォーミング・マーズ・カードゲーム：アレス・エクスペディション
重塑火星：阿瑞斯探險隊
테라포밍 마스: 아레스 익스페디션
boardgame.description:
Terraforming Mars: Ares Expedition is an engine-building game in which players control interplanetary corporations with the goal of making Mars habitable (and profitable). You will do this by investing mega credits (MC) into project cards that will directly or indirectly contribute to the terraforming process. In order to win, you will want to accumulate a high terraform rating (TR) and as many victory points (VP) as you can. Players raise their TR by increasing global parameters: oceans, oxygen, and temperature. TR also determines each corporation's basic income, and, at the end of the game TR counts as VP. Additional VP and production capabilities are awarded for building project cards and other actions taken during the game.

The game is played in rounds, and each round the players will choose one of five phases, which determines which activities will take place during that round. This means every round is different, but can consist of building new project cards, taking general and project-specific actions, producing income and resources (plants and heat), or researching to draw more project cards. Every player will take all the phases selected for the round, and will receive a special bonus during the phase that they selected. To speed up the game, players should resolve each phase simultaneously!

The game board has tracks for oxygen, temperature, and terraform rating, as well as a place for all of the ocean tiles that will be flipped over the course of the game. The game ends when there is enough oxygen to breath (14%), oceans enough to allow Earth-like weather (9), and the temperature is well above freezing (+8°C). It will then be possible, if not comfortable, to live on the surface of Mars!

The winner is the player with the most VP at the end of the game.

[b]Mutiple Small Items:[/b] It may be possible to send multiple small items for cheaper than the above rate. If you are wondering about this possibility, please send me a message.
[size=14][b]Payment Options:[/b][/size]
[size=12][b]Paypal:[/b][/size] No fee is charged to you, if you pay using Paypal. But Paypal does not change currency at the fair market rate. So you will lose 3% or more of your money, if you are converting to Euros.
[size=12][b]IBAN Bank Transfer:[/b][/size] Payment by bank transfer is possible using an IBAN compatible account. [b]There is a 3% discount if you pay using IBAN Bank Transfer[/b] (i.e., your total payment due is 3% less).
[size=12][b]Wise:[/b][/size] There is a 3% discount if you pay using Wise (i.e., your total payment due is 3% less). The company does currency conversion at the fair market rate, and charges the sender a fee of about 0.5% of the amount of money sent.
[size=12][b]Revolut:[/b][/size] There is a 3% discount if you pay using Revolut (i.e., your total payment due is 3% less). The company does currency conversion at the fair market rate, and there are no fees to send money.
[size=12][b]Interac e-transfer:[/b][/size] If you have a Canadian bank account (like me), then you can pay by Interac e-transfer. In this case, you pay in Canadian dollars, at the fair market exchange rate. There is also a 3% discount, if you pay using Interac e-transfer (i.e., your total payment due is 3% less).
[size=12][b]Payment in Dollars:[/b][/size] It is possible to make Paypal payments in US or Canadian dollars, at the fair market exchange rate. You will automatically receive this option, if your address is in the USA or Canada.
[size=14][b]I take responsibility for the safe delivery of your order:[/b][/size] I am a registered commercial seller. Thus, insofar as you are a private consumer, it is required by German law that I take responsibility for any loss or damage of goods that occurs during shipment.
[size=14][b]Looking for something that is not listed here?[/b][/size] I also sell smaller items on BGG here: https://boardgamegeek.com/geekmarket/user/europa_major?pageid=1
If you want to combine items from my other alias, let me know. The flat rate shipping offered there does not apply to the items listed here. The items sold there will typically (but not always) ship for free with the items sold here.
I can also make [size=12][b]special orders[/b][/size] for items that I don't have in stock. Send me a message concerning an item, and I will check for availability and tell you what the price would be.

Title: Terraforming Mars Ares Expedition Publisher: Stronghold Games Language(s): English

boardgame.name: Val de Loire Nivernais: Le jeu
boardgame.description:
Val de Loire Nivernais: Le jeu is an original, local and user-friendly board game based on the principle of questions and answers.

Nearly 550 written questions and photos with also charades and riddles, "junior" questions which deal with subjects as varied as history or geography, heritage, local traditions, current events or famous people who have marked the Val de Loire Nivernais region.

Each player places his pawn on his commune of residence or of his choice among the 110 present on the board, from Cosne-sur-Loire to Decize via Nevers.
You will travel through the territory and have to answer questions on different themes. If the answer is correct you can replay.
To be the winner, you will have to collect 5 "Site" cards by going to their respective box and answering the question correctly.

boardgame.name: JURAQU
boardgame.description:
This game takes you back in time to war-torn, 15th-Century feudal Japan. You begin the game as a poor young peasant with a great ambition. Follow the dice and Ninja cards to your destiny as you move your game piece around the board. You rise (or fall) in rank as you stop at castles and fight grapples, duels or assassination attempts against the other players, who can be your allies or foes at any moment. The first player to attain the rank of Shogun and reach (with the exact role of dice) the golden temple of the capital (Miyako, today’s Kyoto) at the center of the board becomes the TaiShogun (Supreme Shogun) to win the game!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Super Roll Writer: Arcade Edition
boardgame.description:
Created as part of a design challenge to make a roll and write game using only one set of polyhedral dice, Super Roll Writer: Arcade Edition takes the action to the streets with video game-inspired combat in head-to-head and tag team modes.

Players roll their strongest dice and attempt to string together attacks, using weaker dice for rerolls as their fighter fatigues. Dice combinations resolve into strikes on various hit locations on their opponents or into defensive options such as blocking and taunting. A built-in rage meter lets fighters on the ropes turn the damage they've suffered into powerful dice mitigation and combo attacks to battle back from the brink of defeat.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Trivial Pursuit: Franche-Comté
boardgame.description:
(Re)Discover the region Franche-Comté in 1800 questions.

Content: 1 board, 300 question-answer cards, 2 card boxes, 1 die, 6 pie charts, 36 colored marker triangles.

boardgame.name: 1940: Méfiez-vous de vos voisins
boardgame.description:
Immerse yourself in the hidden role game and relive the most dangerous dinner of the Occupation as a Resistant or a Collabo.
Identify your allies, gather clues to win the game before being spotted by the Gestapo.

Betrayals, turnarounds, last-minute alliances; you won't look at your friends the same way again

At the start of the game, each player is assigned a “secret role” card and a “character card”. The character card indicates the specific power of the character during the game. The role card determines which team the player is on. Either the “Collabos” team or the “Resistance” team. The "Resistance" team is always outnumbered regardless of the number of players, but its members know each other at the start of the game unlike the Collabos.
An additional character is present on the board, the German officer. It is not played by anyone and cannot move.

Winning condition:
In order to win the game, the Resistance must accumulate in the same hand a significant number of Resistance clues without being exposed by the Collabos. At any time of the game, even if it is not his turn, a Resident with the required number of Resistance clues, cuts his hand and wins the game with his team.
In order to win the game, the Collabos must succeed in passing five Collabos clues to the German before the Resistance wins.

- Translation from KKBB presentation

boardgame.name: Historical Conquest: The Card Game – Wentworth Cheswell
boardgame.description:
Not playable on their own as you need two starter decks to play the game.

In Historical Conquest, a CCG, there exists five main decks (named decks A thru E) each illustrated with a historical figure on its cover. Each box contains 50 unique illustrated cards.
Use either the standard deck or build your own deck.
Box B has on it's cover Wentworth Cheswell

boardgame.name: Star Arena: Modem
boardgame.description:
To be clear and upfront: You Do~Not Need This Game-Item!! You can easily play the !!FREE!! Card-Game without a Game-Modem!! It just 'really' makes the Game-Play more 'comfortable' and it is therefore a Luxury-Item that is optional to players who can spare some coin.

Yes, There are also advantages to playing with a Modem, such as; When playing Base-Rules your Hero-Card is placed 'Open' _Face-Up_ in front of you and All-Other-Players can read your 'strength' from the card. When you play with a Modem: The Card is placed Vertical in the Card-Slot; Facing You, like you see in the picture above... Which means your enemies see the 'Back' of your Hero-Card and cannot read your strength, thereby losing the ability to 'pick' the weakest target on the battle-grid as easily as in the card-only Base-Game.

In short, the Definition of a Game-Modem is: A Luxury-Card-Holder with a built-in Life and Win-Counter!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Star Arena: Miniatures
boardgame.description:
These are the Official_Game-Pieces that represent the Battle-Classes depicted on the Game-Cards. They are part of a Game-System but are called upon by the Game-Variant played.

For example, in addition to StarArena_The-Card-Game they show your opponents what type of Battle-Class hardware you are playing. (i.e. What type of deck construct)

In StarArena_Arcade-Chess they are an integral part of game-play and represent Arcadian-Armies battling each other and have the Full-Scala of Battle-Classes on the board, even though no-cards are used in this game.

They are meant to be multi-functional collectibles and the Game-Variants ask for their in-game presence or not.

The Collectible 'Base-Set' contains in their entire:

• TITAN: Oyagami (Ancestors.
• TITAN: Shi-Tenno (Game-Kings.
• TITAN: Shugoshin (Guardian-Gods.





• Marshal / Monarch-Class
• General / Hierarch-Class
• Colonel / Clergy-Class
• Guardian / Monastery-Class
• Bomber / Armoury-Class
• Cannon / Ordnance-Class
• Paladin / Cavalry-Class
• Gunner / Artillery-Class
• Sentinel / Legionary-Class
• Soldier / Infantry-Class

This 'Base-Set' are all 'Playable-Clone-Types'(ie: Hardware-Cards) you can Operate on the Battle-Field or in a Battle-Simulation.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Tension: A Queer Cat and Mouse Romp for Two
boardgame.description:
Tension is a two player Tarot based roleplaying game for telling stories like Killing Eve and Hannibal, letting you explore queer experiences in the cat and mouse genre.

Play as an investigator and a killer as they get entangled in each other. You will pursue after another back and forth while everyone in your orbit drops like flies. But it’ll all be worth it, because you’ll be in love. Or dead. Or both maybe? How exciting!

Tension is not a mystery, it’s a dark comedy thriller romance. The killer and the investigator know who the other is, yet they are still inexplicably drawn together. Hijinks and drama ensue as they are trapped in a complicated web of attraction, lies, and even truth.

Content warnings include casual death, drug use, sex work, strong language, and imbalanced power dynamics.

(Publisher Blurb)
boardgame.rpg: Tension: A Queer Cat and Mouse Romp for Two

boardgame.name: Dice Matrix
boardgame.description:
Gather dice from the Dice Matrix according to a simple rule and build the most valuable structure on your area. You will score for the number of dice on the row and column of the die you place. Dice Matrix feels like a puzzle each turn. Tricky tactics await for you as you play more and more.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Star Arena: Miniatures NPC
boardgame.description:
This Non-Player-Class Miniature-Set is separated from the Base-Set because it does not appear in StarArena_Arcade-Chess.

Does 'not' connect to StarArena_TCG in the 'Base-Game'(Card-Only.

But does appear in StarArena_Classic (board-game) when called upon with Card-Types if players wish to play these additions.

They mainly contain 'BLOCKS' and must be seen as Mini-Missions that must be resolved before being allowed to pass. Again; These are called upon by Cards available from the Print_And_Play Card-Factory.

These NPC_Miniatures are abundantly present in Arcade_Adventures currently in development; A Mixture of StarArena_TCG & Arcade-Chess on steroids.

These Mini's are meant to be 'Multi-Functional' Collectibles.

The Collectible_NPC_Set contains in its entire:

• Assassins / Mercenary-Class
• Minions / Underlings to End-Bosses.
• Nemesis / End-Bosses and/or Warlords.
• SIM-Blocks / Blockades and/or Mini-Missions.
• Shrines / Collect a/o Continue Points.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Samusara
boardgame.description:
Japanese Buddhists believe that death is followed by rebirth, a cycle they call Samusara: other Buddhists call it Samsara. This game is dedicated to that tenet.

The goal in Samusara is to occupy the opponent’s power cells or the hilltop cells.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Star Arena: Game Coins
boardgame.description:
The-One Game-Accessory that is Compatible with all StarArena_Variants!!

Simply because the Aim-Of-The-Game in each variant is ultimately: Win And Take The Treasure!!

But they are not just pretty little shiny things, they can have a double function if the Game-Variant in which they used demand it.

In StarArena_Arcade-Chess they are used for Coin-Ups, in plain words; these coins promote your game-piece and improve their signature battle-moves. They are like power-ups in an Arcade-Game and max-out at +3 Coins.

In StarArena_TheCardGame they are used to active certain cards or functions. These type of cards cannot be played until the full combination of coins is acquired or payed.

Currently only 1 Universal-Coin is activated and played with.

• Star-Coin / Yellow

Spoiler-Alert: Their are 8 Colors a/o Coins still hidden from the public. (Manufactured but not yet Activated for Sale.

• Cosmo-Coins / White
• Ferro-Coins / Grey
• Aqua-Coins / Blue
• Aero-Coins / Purple
• Pyro-Coins / Red
• Terra-Coins / Green
• Rocca-Coins / Brown
• Necro-Coins / Black

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: 7 Wonders (Second Edition): Folded Space Insert
boardgame.description:
This insert is compatible with 7 Wonders (Second Edition), including Armada, Cities and Leaders second edition expansions. The design provides both efficient storage and improved game play. Many of the trays can be utilised during the game, and they greatly aid set-up and clear-away times.

Note: The organizer is designed for game with external box dimensions of 29.9 x 29.9 x 7.8 cm. Please note also that this insert only works with the second edition of the game,if you own the original game you need FS-7WO.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Tiny Towns: Folded Space Insert
boardgame.description:
This insert is compatible with Tiny Towns, including Villagers, Fortune and Tiny Trees expansions. The design provides both efficient storage and improved game play. All of the trays can be utilised during the game, and they greatly aid set-up and clear-away times.

Note: Insert designed for game with external box dimensions of 29.7 x 29.7 x 7.3 cm.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Tiny Towns: FLGS and Larkstone Promo Cards

boardgame.name: Civilization: A New Dawn – Folded Space Insert
boardgame.description:
This insert is compatible with Civilization: A New Dawn, including the Terra Incognita expansion. The design provides both efficient storage and improved game play. Many of the trays can be utilised during the game, and they greatly aid set-up and clear-away times.

Note: Insert designed for game with external box dimensions of 29.7 x 29.7 x 7.3 cm.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Civilization: A New Dawn – Terra Incognita

boardgame.name: Black Rose Wars: Alma Mater Studiorum Promo Card
boardgame.description:
Expansion for Base Game

Remove up to 5 cards from your Memories and/or your hand. Shuffle together your Memories and Grimoire. Draw spells from your new Grimoire up to your max hand limit. Gain 3

Search through and 4 from any school of magic. Reshuffle all decks you searched in the Library. Gain 3

boardgame.name: Scepter of the Eternal Flame
boardgame.description:
You are a small group of adventurers in search of the most valuable object of your journeys of discovery. Standing in the long-awaited entrance to the Cave of Ignis, you realize the most dangerous adventure ahead. The cave is about to explode. It's only a matter of time before the lava flows scorch everything inside it forever.

To win reach the exit with the Scepter before time runs out.
If the cave explodes while you are still inside, you lose.
If the cave explodes at the same time you leave, the game ends in a tie because you saved your life but lost the Scepter.

Decide each round together either to equip yourself by using the dice's abilities, that cleverly combined become even stronger, or head out before the cave explodes.
Use each character's individual skills to improve yourself!
Use easy to understand Dice Reference to make the right decisions and roll the dice along the numbers.
And when you're ready as a team, leave the cave as soon as possible.

Your decisions define your destiny! But together you can overcome the challenge!

boardgame.name: Roll and Rock
boardgame.description:
Game currently under testing

Roll and Rock is a 2-4 player game where players control a rock band competing to record the best album.

Roll and Rock is a worker placement game played over 12 rounds.
On each round players send their band-mates to different locations whether to learn some instrument, busking or hire new band-mates.

boardgame.name: Machina Arcana: Card Update Pack
boardgame.description:
This add-on gives you ALL the cards needed to update your 2nd edition to the new 3rd edition!

Includes updated cards from both Core box and "From Beyond" expansion.

boardgame.name: The Horror Game Show
boardgame.description:
In Horror Game Show, the player puts on the role of a producer on a new reality TV show. They have their own team of competitors who they train, equip, advertise and so on.
But they also have somebody else up their sleeve. The Hunters – psychopathic murderers, empty of any feeling or emotion, human monsters. But they are monsters who are bigger stars than any other celebrity.
The aim of the player is of course quite obvious – make the most money and gain the most fame and prestige. Oh, and remember – do not let the competition outsmart you!
The fight to stay on screen and be loved by the crowds is neither easy nor simple. And it’s not a fair fight by any means.
Intrigues, betrayals, temporary alliances and broken deals. The producers will do anything to reach their goal.

How the gameplay looks:
When creating their teams, players also build their own deck of Action Cards. Action cards allow you to move characters on the board, build a pool of "fans" or use special actions (buying new contracts, weapons, using special abilities of characters, etc.). Action cards also determine the order (initiative) in which players can move.
The game is divided into 12 rounds. In each of them, players draw 4 cards and, by playing it alternately, make their moves according to the initiative and the actions assigned to them. They can also use Intrigue Cards - which make the game more difficult for other players. At the start of each new game round, an Event card is drawn that describes "what's new" happened in the program and what circumstances need to be resolved - but this is also possible during the round (players can also initiate their own events themselves).
Characters moving on the board can fight each other. Fight is done by using and influencing a pool of dice (re-rolls, changes to results due to character and / or weapon abilities, etc.). Players earn points for eliminating characters and completing contracts. They can also earn special bonuses for special achievements (most participant eliminations, top performer, last survivor, etc.)

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Nobles & Ne'er Do Wells
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

5e NPCs: Nobles & Ne'er Do Wells brings you 10 new NPCs each with their own backstory, stat block and colour art. Custom abilities and unique histories make this a colourful collection of NPCs for your party to encounter.

There are 20 pages of NPC content with challenges range from 1/4 to 9.

This product includes the following NPCs:

Bastien Poullare - Otiose Orphan

Burkhart Zykleres - Abusive Aristocrat

Viktor Bierjeron - Disingenuous Drighten

Pimnad Butterbiscuit - Peripatetic Poacher

Fanning Rell - Spying Socialite

Henrietta “Henri” Collyer - Spying Socialite

Heng Ko - Passionate Puppeteer

Elizabeth Cantermore - Dissenting Dame

Adlo Hargrav - Lordly Lycanthrope

Kategin Whitecrag - Efficacious Emissary

boardgame.name: Treasury of the Crusade (PF2)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

To Smite the Demon Horde!

The Treasury of the Crusade brings you over 30 new magical items for Pathfinder Second Edition, each perfect to gear up for a righteous crusade where valorous guardians of the mortal realms stand in defiant resistance against the encroaching armies of the demon lords. They range in power from simple trinkets and tokens and magical signaling devices to mighty weapons and powerful artifacts. Some are emblematic of glorious goodness, while others reek of ineff able evil and demoniac damnation, but every one can serve to make your campaign more exciting and your treasure hoards more interesting. They add delightful detail and innovative options for heroes and villains alike, whether found as captured plunder after the sack of an enemy fortress or recovered relics of a lost outpost or expedition, or even granted as a token of esteem by the crusader commanders who keep vigilant watch upon the demonhaunted borderlands. These items range from the militant to the mundane in this book, from weapons and shields to bindings, books, and music boxes. It’s true that a crusader’s heart is not quite so deeply invested in treasure as a mercenary’s or explorer’s, but if it’s a rich assortment of gear for good and bad alike they seek, they are going to love what they find in the Treasury of the Crusade.

boardgame.name: Highhome Caves
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

High in the mountains, this settlement is difficult to reach

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 20 x 30 map depicting a small settlement of cave homes, high in the mountains above a great chasm. Bridges span the gaps

boardgame.name: Grimagia
boardgame.description:
Grimagia is a card game where players take the role of "Grimeisters", summoners who capture monster girls using magical books called grimoires. Players win by capturing 3 of their opponents' monsters, or through eliminating each other player by reducing their HP to 0.

Players share the same 100 card deck. Each turn, a player may perform three actions: playing a monster from their hand, performing a union (combining two monsters to make one stronger monster), and capturing another player's monster using a grimoire (which works in a rock-paper-scissors fashion depending on the opposing monster's type). There are also relic cards with various effects which may be played at any time.

Afterwards, monsters may attack the other players or each other. All monsters have different stats such as health, strength, defense, and special abilities. Monsters who attack become Rested and are defenseless against attacks by other monsters until the player's next turn.

Training to be the perfect rogue takes time..

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 30 x 30 map depicting a thieves' guild hideout in a subterranean base. Training rooms, dorms, meeting halls and a secret cavern entrance.

boardgame.name: Curse of Strahd: Escaping Death House
boardgame.description:
There's a disappointing truth to Death House—the prologue to Curse of Strahd—and it's that it's alternative ending "The Cult is Denied" is just a dull series of rolls. Each character rolls against poisonous smoke. Each character rolls to pass through the scythes. While frightening at first, it quickly loses its charm.

Enter the Skill Challenge: Escaping Death House.

This guide provides a skill challenge as an alternative to the "Cult is Denied" ending. Utilizing—my god, the horror!—their skill proficiencies, the players must achieve five successes before accruing three failures lest they never escape the nightmarish halls of Death House.

If you've never ran a skill challenge before, don't fret. The concepts and rules are explained, and a Frequently Asked Questions section is provided at the end of the module.

boardgame.name: Barovia Hand Drawn Maps
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Included are two hand drawn maps of all of Barovia, to scale with the map included in the campaign book. One map includes location names, the other does not. The PDFs are pretty high resolution so you can zoom in and only use what you need.
boardgame.rpgissuearticle: The Best of the Dungeon Masters Guild

boardgame.name: Curse of Strahd: NPC Map for Dungeon Masters
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Any ambitious DM who has cracked the cover to the wonderful 5e campaign Curse of Strahd knows how incredibly complicated and interrelated the stories are of the many, many NPCs your players will encounter on their perilous journeys.

There are relatives, intrigue and shadowy groups, friends, enemies, hunters and hunted, estranged children, long lost lovers, the dead returning for vengeance and the drunk seeking fortunes.

On the surface CoS looks like a simple adventure. Find some items, slay the big bad bloodsucker. But as any DM who has looked over the book in detail knows, forgetting (or worse: misrepresenting!) the relationships of the NPCs can go a long way to tangle and derail an intricate campaign.

That's why I took the time to craft this detailed "relationship map" for Curse of Strahd. I have painstakingly gone through the book and marked out the most important NPC relationships and even many of the ones that are optional flavor.

I've colored the circles of the people in rough accordance to their plot alignment, if not their actual character alignment. Green tends to be protagonistic, red tends to be antagonistic. Blue tends to be uninvolved or not-necessarily plot-moving characters – but rest assured they're all important! Also the size of their name-circles is a little suggestion as to how important their are to the plot.

This single-paged PDF file is scaled to be printed as an 18x24" poster sized foldout. However you are more than free to simply peruse it to take notes, or print out smaller more manageable sections. I have been able to print it myself on two separate 11x17" pages and tape it together quite well.
boardgame.rpgissuearticle: The Best of the Dungeon Masters Guild

boardgame.name: Curse of Strahd: The Abbot's Journal
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Expand your Curse of Strahd game with this excellent Dungeon Master's resource - a journal from the Abbot in the Abbey of St Markovia!

Use this to:


Aid exposition about the backstory of the Abbot!
Show his insanity via exciting text and descent-into-madness handwriting!
Set the mood of age and rot in Barovia - full-color moldy journal pages!
Tie in Strahd to the Abbot!
Reveal Vasili von Holtz's secret identity!
Explore the creation of the mongrelfolk!
Freak out your players (that last page...shudder!)

boardgame.name: Curse of Strahd: Underhill
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Curse of Strahd: Underhill presents an expanded view of the Yester Hill scenario. All of these evil druids and berserkers just hanging out on top of a muddy hill? It begs for a cave encounter! And that’s what we’re giving you here with Underhill.
boardgame.rpgissuearticle: The Best of the Dungeon Masters Guild

boardgame.name: Iniciativa
La Iniciativa
The Initiative
Le Projet
Ügynökség
Инициатива
boardgame.description:
The Initiative — a unique co-operative board game of story, strategy, and code-breaking — lets players take on the role of teenagers in 1994 who have found a mysterious board game called "The Key". Not only will they play The Key, but players will help the teens through a pivotal chapter of their lives by following a series of missions linked together via an interactive comic book.

The game's campaign is broken into a number of chapters, each taking 30-60 minutes to complete and each starting with you reading a page of the comic book. The story advances even if players fail a mission, but winning may provide a reward in the future. Each chapter builds on the knowledge and story from previous chapters, weaving narrative, code-breaking, and mystery into one thrilling game experience.

boardgame.name: Descending the Stairs
boardgame.description:
Standing at the top of the steep and narrow stairs - hot, sweaty, exhilarated.
Feeling thoroughly spent. A night at your favorite club is over.
But tonight, the club closes forever.
What will you take with you as you descend the stairs for the last time?

Descending the Stairs is a storytelling game for 1 to 6 players. It can be played face to face, over video call software, or by forum.

Descending the Stairs is about relationships. It focuses on the players and their characters’ subjective impressions of the Club, their history with it, and how that impacts their relationships with others.

For the best experience, expect to listen to each other as the world is being built around you, be attentive to what your fellow players are saying, and incorporate their stories into your own answers.

In person, playing through the full deck takes 90 minutes to 2 hours. A shorter game can be played by using two-thirds or half of the deck.

boardgame.description:
This promo introduces the happy Oshax and 1 hand of Vesh rare treasure tile to the game.

Mix these new tiles in with your existing tiles for an even wider selection of options as you play the game.
