[b]All prices are inclusive of UK and EU VAT, but do not include shipping costs.[/b]
[size=14][b]Flat Rate Shipping:[/b][/size]
The shipping cost is the same regardless of the number of items ordered: 2 Euros within Germany. 3 Euros to Albania, Australia, Belarus, Brazil, Canada, China, Faroe Islands, Greenland, Iceland, Indonesia, Israel, Japan, Liechtenstein, Malaysia, New Zealand, Norway, Russia, Singapore, South Korea, Switzerland, Taiwan, Thailand, Turkey, and the USA. 4 Euros to Austria, Belgium, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Czech Republic, Cyprus, Estonia, Finland, France, Greece, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Lithuania, Luxemburg, Macedonia, Malta, Mexico, Moldavia, Monaco, Montenegro, Netherlands, Poland, Portugal, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Ukraine, United Kingdom, and Vietnam. 5 Euros to Bulgaria, Croatia, Denmark, Hungary, Romania, and Sweden. 6 Euros to all other countries.
NOTE: The shipping rates for deliveries outside of the EU and UK have been discounted to make up for the fact that no VAT is paid for sales outside of the EU and UK. However, there may be import taxes for deliveries outside of the EU and UK, and the buyer is responsible paying these.
[size=14][b]Payment Options:[/b][/size]
[size=12][b]Paypal:[/b][/size] No fee is charged to you, if you pay using Paypal. But Paypal does not change currency at the fair market rate. So you will lose 3% or more of your money, if you are converting to Euros.
[size=12][b]IBAN Bank Transfer:[/b][/size] Payment by bank transfer is possible using an IBAN compatible account. [b]There is a 3% discount if you pay using IBAN Bank Transfer[/b] (i.e., your total payment due is 3% less).
[size=12][b]Wise:[/b][/size] There is a 3% discount if you pay using Wise (i.e., your total payment due is 3% less). The company does currency conversion at the fair market rate, and charges the sender a fee of about 0.5% of the amount of money sent.
[size=12][b]Revolut:[/b][/size] There is a 3% discount if you pay using Revolut (i.e., your total payment due is 3% less). The company does currency conversion at the fair market rate, and there are no fees to send money.
[size=12][b]Interac e-transfer:[/b][/size] If you have a Canadian bank account (like me), then you can pay by Interac e-transfer. In this case, you pay in Canadian dollars, at the fair market exchange rate. There is also a 3% discount, if you pay using Interac e-transfer (i.e., your total payment due is 3% less).
[size=12][b]Payment in Dollars:[/b][/size] It is possible to make Paypal payments in US or Canadian dollars, at the fair market exchange rate. You will automatically receive this option, if your address is in the USA or Canada.
[size=14][b]I take responsibility for the safe delivery of your order:[/b][/size] I am a registered commercial seller. Thus, insofar as you are a private consumer, it is required by German law that I take responsibility for any loss or damage of goods that occurs during shipment.
[size=12][b]Looking for something that is not listed here?[/b][/size]
I also sell larger items on BGG here: https://www.boardgamegeek.com/geekmarket/user/the_canadian_gamer?pageid=1
If you want to combine items from my other alias, let me know. The flat rate shipping offered here does not apply to the items listed there. The items sold here will typically (but not always) ship for free with the items sold there.
I can also make [size=12][b]special orders[/b][/size] for items that I don't have in stock. Send me a message concerning an item, and I will check for availability and tell you what the price would be.
weight: 15 grams + packaging

boardgame.name: The Rapid and the Righteous
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You are a smooth operator – a special agent in a world of street-racing and criminal investigation. Your profession takes you all over the world – your life is fast cars, beautiful people and dangerous situations.

boardgame.name: Dead Channel
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Dead Channel is a game of straight-to-video horror movies that play out according to trope – your “injury” tables, each different depending on your character type, push the story forwards until everyone is dead, mad, corrupted or has escaped. Download it here.

boardgame.name: Giant Goddamn Robots
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Draw giant robots, line them up against each other, and then throw dice and cards at each other to simulate combat. It’s daft. You might like it! It’s free! What have you got to lose?

boardgame.name: Stone the Crows
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You’re a corvid and you’re gonna rob the Crown Jewels from the Tower of London and if you so much as breathe a word of this to anyone I’ll have your beak you understand me boy?

boardgame.name: Black Swan: UberTex Map
boardgame.description:
"Uber Tex" game map for Black Swan.

Printed on a high quality waterproof PPE canvas, the BLACK SWAN UberTex Map is 44% larger than the one included in the Game Box.

149 cm x 104 cm, rolled

boardgame.name: I'm a Lover, Not a Fighter
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In this Honey Heist hack, you’ll take on the role of beautiful adventurous vagabonds with two stats: LOVER and FIGHTER. Can you rescue someone important from the Baron’s Annual Masked Ball via the medium of kissing and/or stabbing? Find out!
boardgame.rpg: I'm a Lover, Not a Fighter

boardgame.name: Briarwood
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The briarwoods are shadowed, ancient and dangerous; the ruins of civilisations that tried to conquer them in ages past, choked with thorn and root, are riddled with cults and monsters too wild and too fearsome to show their faces in the towns and cities that surround it.

YOU are an outcast yourself – a sell-sword, an apostate, an outsider. An ailing village on the outskirts has hired you to venture within and reclaim their chapel’s stolen relic that, they claim, will rid them of the curse that has befallen them ever since it was stolen by the inhabitants of the woods.

boardgame.name: Orcball
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A one-page game about trying to win the international ORCBALL championship despite a) the blatant cheating of the other team and b) the fact that all the refs are out of their gourds on shrooms and yelling at the moon in an attempt to learn more, better rules.

boardgame.name: Nice Marines
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

YOU ARE A SPACE MARINE: an immortal giant genetically engineered to be the perfect instrument of war. You and your squadmates are oathsworn protectors of the Astral Commonwealth - and one another. The iconoclasts of the galaxy shiver in terror at the very mention of your name.

However: support forces have not arrived following the recent liberation of Vannis, leaving you in charge of a diplomatic envoy dedicated to rebuilding after the conflict. You have no idea how to do this.

However: you’ve got one solar week until your superiors arrive to inspect the city, so best get to it!

boardgame.name: Sepulchre
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A sawn-off version of the Resistance System that powers Spire is at the core of this one-page game.

Take on the role of desperate relic hunters and seize power from wealthy occultists in a city sunken beneath the frozen wasteland of the North.

boardgame.name: Night Hag
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You haven't slept in days after you woke up with a monster crouched on your chest - and you know that if you fall asleep again, it'll find you and kill you.

Unless you find it and kill it first.

A grim one-page RPG where characters get weaker and less stable the longer the game continues.

boardgame.name: Farbenkampf-Spiel
boardgame.description:
Each player has 9 pawns of 5 colors. The game board consists of squares of the same 5 colors and white squares. Each color has a strength value between 1 and 5 points. On white spaces the strength of the pawns matches their own value, on all other spaces the strength of the pawns take on the point value of the space.

Movement and capture is 1 space in any direction but not diagonally. A pawn may capture any pawn of lesser strength.

A player wins the game by eliminating all pawns of his opponent. If both players have only one pawn left, the player with the stronger pawn wins.

—user summary

boardgame.name: A Haunting by the Shadow
boardgame.description:
A Haunting by the Shadow is a cooperative game in which 2-4 players investigate a house overrun by dark and sinister spirits. The spirits are led by a greater evil known as the Shadow. Players must discover items within the house to help them eliminate the ominous spirits. But time is against them. With each passing moment, the Shadow's power grows. If the players take too long in their search, the spirits could unleash an untold terror into the world.

Players will take actions to move, search, or vanquish spirits that are haunting the Harris House. Players will gather items that will allow them to vanquish the spirits. Before the players get the items, they must avoid interacting with the spirits and must avoid the Shadow at all costs.

If the players vanquish the 4 spirits, the players collectively win and the Shadow is defeated.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Dribble, Shoot, Roll!
boardgame.description:
Dribble, Shoot, Roll! is a 2-player basketball card game in which players take on the role of a Head Coach, draft a team, and roll dice to score points.

Players begin the game by having a Draft. During the Draft, players will take turns drawing and drafting basketball players to form their basketball team. Each basketball player has a skill level (1-6) for each of the shot attempt skills. The higher the skill number, the higher the chance of that player scoring on their shot attempt.

Once their teams are established, players will begin play. Players will shuffle their player decks and draw the top 5 basketball player cards to form their lineup. They then will choose one player from their lineup to put into the scoring position.

Next, one player will reveal the Shot Attempt Card and reveal what shot the players will attempt. Both players will roll their basketball die and compare the number rolled with their basketball player's skill number of the shot that is being attempted. If the player's skill number is equal to or exceeds the number the player rolled on his/her die, then the scoring attempt is successful. The player gains the number of points the shot attempt awards (1,2, or 3 points). Players then move their scoring marker on their player scoreboard.

Players will repeat this process until the Shot Attempt Deck is depleted. This completes a quarter. The game consists of 4 quarters. After all 4 quarters, the game ends and the player with the highest score wins.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Tiny Fluxx
boardgame.description:
A two-person Fluxx variant created for the 25th anniversary of Looney Labs and included with orders from the publisher in January 2021.

Tiny Fluxx is a two-player introduction to the world of Fluxx, featuring five tiny Keepers--an ant, a ladybug, a computer chip, a chocolate chip. Consists of 21 miniature-sized cards.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: SHARP Magical Traditions
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Description and elaborated rules of 15 magical traditions for SHARP (Simple Handy Adaptable Role-Playing):
• Blood Magic
• Chaos Magic
• Charming Magic
• Corruption Magic
• Divine Magic
• Hermetic Magic
• Illusion Magic
• Martial Arts
• Nature Magic
• Psionics
• Rune Magic
• Seraphic Magic
• Song Magic
• Spirit Magic
• Trophy Magic

boardgame.name: Heart: The City Beneath Quickstart Edition
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Heart: The City Beneath is a tabletop roleplaying game about delving into a nightmare undercity that will give you everything you’ve ever dreamed of – or kill you in the process.

It is a dungeon-crawling, story-forward tabletop RPG from the designers of Spire that focuses on what characters have to lose in pursuit of their dreams in the chaotic darkness beneath the world.

Sharing a setting with Spire, Heart expands the unreal world beneath it. It uses an expanded and updated version of the Resistance system, the mechanics that power Spire, to help you tell stories of desperation, hubris and adventure in the City Beneath.

The Heart quickstart provides you with basic rules, a selection of pre-generated characters and the introductory scenario "Drowned".

boardgame.name: Burned and Broken
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Burned and Broken is a sourcebook for the Heart roleplaying game with details on how to bring characters from Spire into Heart and how to use the themes of the Ministry in regular campaigns.

Inside, you’ll find:


A new way of playing Heart: flee the Ministry after they’ve turned against you and make your way to the City Beneath
Origins for each Spire character class that allow them to function as characters in Heart
More information on Derelictus, the City Between, giving players the chance to explore it as though it were a series of landmarks and delves
The Minister calling, which allows players to quest for fragments of Our Hidden Mistress
Four new spells for those devoted to the dark goddess
Active Operations of the Ministry in the Heart, each a plot hook for a zealous character or crew

boardgame.name: Sanctum
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Build fantastical, tragic settlements under threat from within and without.

Do your level best to defend them and keep the people inside alive and prosperous.

Watch, broken, as an emissary of a vast alien Mind arrives and tears apart the walls like paper.

Sanctum is a sourcebook for the Heart RPG. Inside, you’ll find a guide to building havens with your group to create the basis for an exciting campaign. You’ll also find advice on running haven-based campaigns, special fallout results that reflect your settlement's trials and tribulations, and ways to create and reinforce bonds with the people within. Finally, you’ll find rules for four new types of angel, the fell-handed messengers of the Heart Itself which infiltrate and smash apart havens. You'll also enjoy in-character ramblings on them from washed-up pulp fiction author Gris Hannemann who, potentially, invented them to sell more copies of his books. But they’re real now.

boardgame.name: Vermissian Black Ops
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

From the depths of the cursed mass transit network known as the Vermissian, the Ministry of Our Hidden Mistress wages a shadow war against their cruel high elf overlords.

You are part of the Throne Division: cells of black ops paramilitary assets drawn from the people of the Heart. You undertake vital missions in support of the Ministry’s cause, using the miles of twisting tunnels to move secretly through the city.

This sourcebook for the Heart RPG contains expanded and alternative rules for sending your undercity delvers on dangerous missions for the dark elf revolutionary front. You’ll also find information on the factions that make the Vermissian their home, details on Throne Division equipment, a guide to building operations and a line-by-line breakdown of the network.

boardgame.name: The One With All The Cards
boardgame.description:
A fan-made "Cards Against Humanity"-style game, based on the popular TV show 'Friends'. It can be played as a standalone game, or treated like an expansion deck for the original game. Played with the same rules as Cards Against Humanity.

The game is simple. Each round, one player asks a question from a Black Card, and everyone else answers with their funniest White Card.

Game includes 90 black cards and 144 white cards.

listing.notes:
See seller info bellow.
195

boardgame.name: Shadow Operations
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A Spire One-Shots Book

Climb aboard the Last Train and steal the secrets of its locomotion. Assassinate the most powerful man in the lawless undercity of Red Row. Defend the wedding of Brother Hellion’s only daughter at the Church of the Gun. Spring a gnoll prisoner-of-war from the best-defended prison in all of Spire. Kidnap a reborn Saint gone rogue on the streets of Pilgrim’s Walk.

boardgame.name: A Very Northern Christmas
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Look: this gets very High Concept very quickly.

You’re Sean Bean – all of you. Each of you is five Seans Bean. You have to survive to the end of a film so you’ll be allowed to finally die on your own terms because you were cursed by a Cosmic Demon Witch back when the world was young. You also have to act in, write, shoot, light and cater the film.

Okay? Okay.

Merry Christmas.

boardgame.name: Sad Vampire Boyfriend
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The world is burning, dark and strange: but you are in love.

Play as a vampire or a mortal in this one-page RPG and get in too much trouble as you freewheel through relationships and betrayals. Inspired by the rules behind Belonging Outside Belonging, SAD VAMPIRE BOYFRIEND is designed to be played over two or three linked sessions of play.

Comes with some drawings of bats.

boardgame.name: Be Prepared
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Can you survive a night in the forest, even as an ancient terror is trying to hunt you down and kill you? Probably not.

Take on the role of desperate, incompetent scouts trapped in the cruel and unforgiving woods as an ancient evil attempts to eat them in this one-page RPG.

boardgame.name: Reverse Beastmaster
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In a collaboration with famed sci-fi author and general Nate Crowley, Grant Howitt created a game where you play a human with an unusual curse: you have to do whatever any animal tells you to do.

boardgame.name: The Witch House
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

She stole you from your family

Called you Beast and cut your name away

Stuck you with needles and pushed bones down your throat

Sang your eyes into different shapes

Kill her

Before you are lost forever

A one-page RPG about playing the transformed familiars of a cruel witch and trying to kill her in order to escape.

boardgame.name: Dungeonscrawl: The Palace of the Briar Prince
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Dungeonscrawl is an OSR game in the vein of Into The Odd which comes with a full system for generating your own random dungeon by drawing rooms on index cards and playing through them. Also has a big drawing of an elf!

boardgame.name: We Three Kings
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

It’s Christmas Day, 0AD. You are a trio of Kings from lands afar – a swordsman, a necromancer, and a sorcerer. You are going to defeat the wicked King Herod and his forces with two-fisted magic, jumping off buildings and kicking people into giant snakes. You are going to save baby Jesus and, by extension, save EVERY CHRISTMAS EVER.

boardgame.name: Genius Loci
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You are a small god, a genius loci, in a quiet country town in 1960’s south England.

boardgame.name: This is Not a Place of Honor
This is Not a Place of Honour
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Take on the roles of devout pilgrims searching for the treasures of the ancients AND the terrified, panicking humans who would go on to become those ancients as they crash-land a doomed colony ship into a backwater planet on the edge of civilised space in this one-page RPG.
boardgame.rpg: This is Not a Place of Honour

boardgame.name: Beautiful Space Pirates in: "The Galaxy's Most Dangerous Funeral!"
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Take on the role of a beautiful space pirate and claim the inheritance that is rightfully yours. Summon chandeliers! Fall in love with an alien daguerreotypist, only to have them die in your arms two scenes later! Marry off Balthazar Germaine’s awful stepchild! All this and more awaits you in BEAUTIFUL SPACE PIRATES in THE GALAXY’S MOST DANGEROUS FUNERAL, the most fabulous one-page RPG yet.
boardgame.rpg: Beautiful Space Pirates in: "The Galaxy's Most Dangerous Funeral!"

boardgame.name: Kobold Endeavor
Kobold Endeavour
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You are a kobold, a scrawny dragonling whelp, and you have been tasked by the capricious and cruel MIGHTY DRAGON KING to sneak into a rival dragon’s hoard and steal as much loot as you possibly can in order to win favour. Problem is, you’re terrible at everything – except creating distractions. Can you stack up enough distractions to get in, get the treasure, and get out alive? Probably not.

boardgame.name: Wake
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Play a coma patient trying to escape from a murderous, shifting dreamscape. Beset by hungry ghosts and outgunned by the heartless Sleepers, you’ve got two ways out: wake up or die trying.

A one-page RPG that requires a d12 and a pack of playing cards to use.

boardgame.name: Tramforce
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Following the collapse of British society after a disastrous Brexit, law enforcement has been forced to use unusual methods to keep the peace. Taking advantage of the extensive tram networks in the UK, police officers can now jack their powered armour suits directly into moving trams to ensure that they can fight crime wherever they need to - as long as it's within six feet of a tram. This ground-breaking one-page RPG and bleak vision of the future also contains OPERATION: CHRISTMAS, which sees illumination zealots from Blackpool descend upon Eastbourne and attempt to steal their Christmas lights.

boardgame.name: :Retrograde:
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You just woke up, and you can't remember a thing. People are after you. You need answers, fast.

boardgame.name: The Five
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A decade ago, the Queen died, and her wards faltered, and the corruption came into the world. It is oil and smoke and brass and clockwork; it is industry, and toil, and ceaseless labour. We fight back against its armies but we are a dwindling few.

A one-page RPG of protection and fighting against corruption.

boardgame.name: Pride & Extreme Prejudice
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A hand-created one-page RPG about proper ladies of a marriageable age and their giant robots powered by a malign eldritch intelligence. Will you find a suitable husband? Will you repel the French invaders? Will your eternity reactor leak and drive you and your sisters irrevocably mad, haunted my whispers from the dark between the stars? And – will you be late for the ball on Thursday eve?

boardgame.name: Unfinished Business
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You're a ghost. You can't manifest physically in the real world, but you need to get revenge on the people who killed you. So: possess people, channel your nightmare phantom powers through the fragile human bodies of your hosts, evade ghost-hunters, and show your murderers that death is not the end. (For you, anyway. It will be for them.)

boardgame.name: Keepsakes
boardgame.description: In Keepsakes, players create a line of memories, competing to select, arrange, and recall those memories in order to gain the most Keepsakes, representing the player's score. Players start with two Keepsakes, and may gain or lose more as they complete challenges and recite the line of memories, represented by various face-up and face-down cards. Players take turns by drawing a new memory card, adding it to the line of memories, defining the memory, and reciting the line of memories in order, starting with the first one played. Players may then call out if the person seems to have done something incorrectly, with Keepsakes trading hands accordingly. Each memory card is different; they may require players to say something only they know, something they can see, something that they prefer, etc. Sometimes tasks appear, requiring players to complicate their turns, or players can opt for available challenges to increase their Keepsake collection. Some memory cards may reorder the memory line or be turned face-down, forcing players to reorient themselves or risk losing Keepsakes. Play ends when any player has zero Keepsakes remaining or the memory deck runs out, and whoever has the most Keepsakes wins (ties permitted. With that in mind players can opt to play cooperatively instead to attempt to gather the most Keepsakes collectively.

boardgame.name: The Resistance Toolbox: Welcome to the Resistance
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

We've taken the core rules that power Spire - the Resistance System - and put them into this free system reference PDF. Inside, we present guidelines and rules for making your own game using the Resistance System, as well as plenty of examples of the sort of things you can do with it.

The document is released under Creative Commons, which means that you're free to use the rules within in your own works as long as you credit us within them.

boardgame.name: MECHAMUROIDIA
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Ever wanted to play a quick and easy mech game where the pilots are genetically modified super-smart mice (and maybe one rat)? Based on the Honey Heist system by Grant Howitt, MECHAMURIOIDIA mashes together "mouse media" like Redwall and The Secret of NIMH with small-squad mech media like Gen:LOCK and Voltron for a wild and wacky low-prep mouse mech adventure. Suit up and roll out!

For 1 GM and 3-6 players. Play time 1-3 hrs.

boardgame.name: Skel-IT-ons
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

One GM guides 1-5 players through a day in the life of their characters- skeletons who work in the IT department of some big corporate entity. Every PC is a skeleton, and every NPC is a normal human.

If you have to ask why you’re playing as skeletons and nobody’s noticed, well, you must not have worked in IT before.

boardgame.name: Chicken Coup
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You are chickens living in the Coop, a mega complex for chicken-kind. As young revolutionaries, your goal is to topple the pecking order, and remove the rooster patriarch from the top.

boardgame.name: Drags 2 Riches
boardgame.description:
Drags 2 Riches is the deckbuilding card game that finally allows you to live your drag truth. Take on the role of a drag queen building up your wardrobe of fierce and fabulous heels, wigs, outfits, make-up and accessories, laying them down in combinations that will stun the competition.

Players work on their looks in secret, deciding whether to reveal them at the end of the round, or keep them hidden and build even more fabulous combos ready to win the most prestigious events. Every round is full of tension and excitement as you never know who will reveal a look, and only one of you queens can win!

So, if you want to slay the competition… be fabulous, be sassy, and most of all, be fierce!

Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Titas of Arkham
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You’re a group of professional women who’ve met for brunch at Maria Gracia Cafe to catch up with each other’s lives… until cultists open a dimensional rift, threatening to summon an Outer God. The restaurant is under siege, and you’re reality’s last hope!

boardgame.name: Crystal Caper
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

It’s the SEASON FINALE and you must get the crystals from the baddies! Two things:


One: Your magic is powerful and UNSTABLE



Two: You are a HECKIN’ TEEN GIRL

boardgame.name: HoneyCon 2018
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A group of bears are going to undertake the greatest heist the world has ever known - AGAIN!

Two Things:

ONE - You are part of the organizing and security committee of Honeycon 2018 and you will do anything to make sure it goes smoothly (unlike last year).

TWO - You are also GODDAMN BEARS!

boardgame.name: What's So Cool About Cute Mythical Girls Dating Each Other?
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is a game about cute mythical girls dating each other and probably having sex, wings and tentacles and all. If you like monster girls and awkward flirting and adventure and magic with a very simple 2d6 dice mechanic, this game is for you!
boardgame.rpgseries: What Is So Cool About Jam
boardgame.rpg: What's So Cool About Cute Mythical Girls Dating Each Other?

boardgame.name: I Wanna Kiss a Girl, I Wanna Hold Her Tight, Maybe Make a Little Magic in the Moonlight
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is a gmless letter-writing game for one or more people about kissing girls. In this game you will roll dice, draw cards, and write letters to a made-up person or to the other players about your experiences kissing girls.

This is a simplified Wretched & Alone game that can be played single-player or with friends!
boardgame.rpg: I Wanna Kiss a Girl, I Wanna Hold Her Tight, Maybe Make a Little Magic in the Moonlight

boardgame.name: Lemurs on the Loose
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

You are a lemur, and you’re stuck in a cage. You don’t want that anymore, do you? So do something about it! It’s time to escape the zoo.

boardgame.name: Coven Caper
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

It’s MageCon 2020, and the wizards running the Maggies—the awards show for magical innovation—have once again nominated only other wizards! Fed up with being shut out of the competition, you and your fellow witches have made a plan to storm the awards ceremony and take what’s rightfully yours: the Golden Maggie.

boardgame.name: Tank Robbery
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In Tank Robbery, you play a team of shelled animals with special ops training who have to steal a tank from the oppressive humans who are encroaching on your territory. What you do with that tank afterwards is up to you.

Tank Robbery is a tabletop role-playing game for 2 or more players. You'll need paper, pencils, and a few six-sided dice to play.

boardgame.name: Soapbox Derby
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

It’s the Laramar county Downhill Soapbox Derby, and you’re a team of racers, ready to win - by any means necessary.
...
Players have two stats - momentum and control, which change as the race unfolds, narrated by a GM. Will your team claim the prize, or spin out?

boardgame.name: Space Monkey Mafia
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Described as "the space-monkey heist game you never knew you needed"

You are an ex-NASA ape turned mobster, returning to Cape Canaveral for one last big heist. Will you get your revenge on the organisation who shunned you?

boardgame.name: Top Pop
boardgame.description:
It is the 1960s, and soda pop has taken off as America's go-to drink. Instead of just getting the refreshing drink over the counter, the soda companies have bottled their sensational soft drink. These bottles are showing up in all of the major cities in grocery stores and vending machines. As the owner of a soda pop company, you need to make sure that your product captures the market it deserves in all of the major cities and that it knocks out the competition leaving just one top pop.

Top Pop is a card game in which players are placing city cards onto the table and stacking bottle caps (which represent the company's influence) onto the played cities on the table. At the start of a player's turn, if their bottle cap is on a higher stack than the other players on a city card, that player collects that city; if not, they continue to try to gain dominance on city cards where they can. Each city comes in two types: day and night. Day city cards are played face-up on the table for all to see. Night city cards are played face down and only the player who played the card and whoever it is in front of can see it. At the end of the game, players earn points for majority control in a city and sets of cities collected.

In the advanced version of the game, cities also have powers that are earned when a city is collected. A player continues to maintain their power until another player has collected the associated city, at which the power is then transferred.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Organizations: Game Designers of North Carolina

boardgame.name: Face to Face at Antietam
boardgame.description:
"Face to Face at Antietam" is a 2 player American Civil War Card-Wargame, players make decisions for general Robert E. Lee or general George McClellan as they guide the Army of Northern Virginia or the Army of the Potomac in America's deadliest day of combat at Antietam. An Event card is drawn each turn that simulates real historical events then each side commands infantry, artillery, cavalry and their generals within three terrains and two flanks. Dice rolling keeps a degree of randomness in an otherwise tactical battle.

Be the first to capture two of the three terrains and drive General Lee away or change history and crush General McClellan.

-description from designer

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: You Don't Know Jack: TV Expansion Pack
boardgame.description: This add-on set for the tabletop YOU DON'T KNOW JACK game includes 113 cards with 450 additional questions about you favorite TV shows of the past & present. Like the original, each question has that wacky YDKJ twist to make it that much more interesting and challenging!

boardgame.name: Library Generator
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Generate quirky fantasy Libraries for your worlds!

This Library Generator contains tools and tables to quickly build a strange and unique library to place within cities, towns or the wildnerness of your campaign world. Roll your D20 against tables to determine the architecture of the Library, and the odd Librarian who resides there.

boardgame.name: Preformed Settings: Volume One
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

'Realm Fables: Preformed Settings' is a 56 page book that contains two fully formed settings, ready to be dropped into your current campaign or used to begin a new one. 'Salt & Rime' and 'Shadow & Ash' are system neutral micro-settings.
...
SALT & RIME:

A location of icy seas, whalers, ghosts and pirates to be placed into your campaign or game world. Perhaps the party will join Captain Thyra and the crew of the Quiet Baroness, to aid them in their search to uncover the cure of the Frost-Torn sickness? Or, maybe, they will take the ship for themselves by force and sail alone between the icy isles. They could find shelter with the Human Whalers in the old Whaler’s Station, or avoid the humans and pirates altogether and seek to befriend the strange People of the Pass to gain access to their ancient knowledge of magical language, songs and sturdy canoes.

SHADOW & ASH:

A Witch Hex Crawl system neutral setting for your campaigns. The Boundless Coven experiment with dark rituals here, while the Starlit and Umbra Covens attempt to keep balance. Druids wander the wilds. The Aos Sí, Highfolk, walk the heath in their spirit forms and sit beside ancient burial mounds that scatter the land. The Fomóiri, Lowfolk, haunt the dark nights beneath the stars, preying on lost travellers. Those born beneath certain star signs on cloudless nights are gifted with the Glint, witch powers of different origins. Perhaps the party will seek out the Umbra Coven and aid them in their plight against the Boundless Witches of the Whispering Fen, and in return gain knowledge of shadow magic. Alternatively, they may avoid the Covens and their war altogether, and traverse the deep wilds of the Quarter Lands and uncover old secrets in the Mountains of Wraith’s Range. This Hex Crawl can be used as a place of over-world travel, an entire campaign setting, or even a floating, magical plane riddled with Glint magic of the Witch Covens, all to be learned and added to your players’ characters’ spell books.

boardgame.name: Preformed Settings - Maps
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Map Print Files for Realm Fables: Preformed Settings: Volume One

These two world map files are for use with the Preformed Settings book, but can be used as inspiration for your own world!

Map of the Quarter Lands (Shadow & Ash Setting)
Map of the Scattered Isles (Salt & Rime Setting)

boardgame.name: Villain Generator
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Generate a Unique Villain in minutes!

The 'Villain Generator' contains tools and tables to generate the motivations, background, personal grudges, dark missions and even the likeable traits of a fully fleshed out, interesting antagonist.

All you need is your D20 to quickly create a worthy opponent for any adventuring party!

boardgame.name: World Generator: Volume One
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

FANTASY WORLD GENERATOR!

- Grab your D20 and generate your new campaign world in minutes!

'Realm Fables: World Generator' is a 56 page book of tables, tools and charts to aid you in the creation of a new fantasy world. All you need is your D20 to get the ideas flowing! 'World Generator' is full of useful, bold tables which you can use to roll up unique items or entire continents for your world! The source-book also contains theory, tools, and charts.

Also includes a World Generatring D6 Quick-Build Tool, and a Seven Step Dungeon tool!

boardgame.name: The Hammered Hobgoblin
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A hobgoblin shrine, a murdered monk, and an adventurer’s retirement plan. The Hammered Hobgoblin is a tavern with a bloody history – a history anyone could get caught up in for the want of a cold beer and a warm bed.

Small Dungeons are inconspicuous locations that can be dropped into almost any fantasy setting. The Hammered Hobgoblin includes the following:


A short background
Location description
Location maps – Gamemaster and Player versions
Adventure hooks
Location poster map of the Hammered Hills
Location poster map of the Hammered Hobgoblin

boardgame.name: Vile Tooth Gully
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Tangled vines encircle the rocky cliff walls bringing with them small sickly flowers and thorny foliage. Below them a creek slowing meanders through the gully passing ferns and boulders overgrown by the moss of ages. To either side of the gully grassy knolls lead deeper into the forest and toward an eroded cliff-side that has a stone staircase.

The staircase leads to an upper cliff-face where vines crisscross the gully having grown around the giant stones and holding others that have fallen from above in place. Cumbersome sticks scatter the ground and a large well crafted nest sits at the far side, holding within it three precious eggs.

boardgame.name: Nocturnus Village
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The roadway meanders through the forest of the nightfolk before reaching a wide river which it then follows till you reach the village of Nocturnus. Great trees reach towards the heavens from their cliff side perch, while the river falls down towards the beyond.

A bridge has been formed of roots and living branches that leads into the small village where a tavern and some small houses are. Ramps also formed of these living roots take you up to many walkways where shrines have been carved into the trees.

boardgame.name: Rotworm Village
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The roadway meanders through the rotting forest before reaching a wide river which it then follows till you reach the remains of what is now called Rotworm Village. Great trees reach towards the heavens from their cliff side perch, while the river falls down towards the low lands beyond, covered in encroaching darkness.

A bridge has been formed of roots and living branches that leads into the small village where skeletal remains can be found and nests of the most foul creatures. Ramps also formed of these living roots take you up to many walkways.

boardgame.name: Winter's Edge Village
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The roadway meanders through the snowy forest before reaching a wide river which it then follows till you reach the village of Winter’s Edge. Great trees reach towards the heavens from their cliff side perch, while the river falls down towards the low lands beyond.

A bridge has been formed of roots and living branches that leads into the small village where a tavern and some small houses are. Ramps also formed of these living roots take you up to many walkways where shrines have been carved into the trees.

boardgame.name: Elven Village
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The roadway meanders through the forest before reaching a wide river which it then follows till you reach the elven Village. Great trees reach towards the heavens from their cliff side perch, while the river falls down towards the low lands beyond.

A bridge has been formed of roots and living branches that leads into the small village where a tavern and some small houses are. Ramps also formed of these living roots take you up to many walkways where shrines have been carved into the trees.

boardgame.name: High Pass Fortress
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A grand bastion stands, overlooking the winding city streets far below. Large stone pillars line the streets leading up to the great wooden engraved gates of the fortress, which are flanked by stone statues and murder holes.

When inside, the first corridor leads both to a feasting area which is connected to a small kitchen with the other end of the corridor leading to sleeping quarters and barracks. A set of stairs leads up to jail cells that over look the city and are used for political prisoners.

Next to this room is a library and study area, small slits in the stone walls cascading light over the dusty tombs that lie within and down the very end of the fortress lies the vault room which contains artifacts and weapons of previous generals of this city.

Adventure Seed

After a recent adventure went awry one of your companions has been afflicted by a wasting disease that hasn’t been seen in over a thousand years. No herbalists have been able to help and even magical means of healing have failed.

With time short you’ve had to reach out to contacts that may hold a specific ancient tome which you’ve been informed may contain a cure. Unfortunately however the only library who still holds this tome belongs to the city of High Pass and is under the private care of their military wing.

They won’t let you in as the library contains information within which is considered classified and they also won’t allow you to take the tome out. With little choice left you’ll have to break into the fortress and recover the tomb by whatever means you can muster.

boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A grand bastion stands, overlooking the river styx far below. Large stone pillars line the ash plains leading up to the great stone engraved gates of the fortress, which are flanked by stone statues and murder holes.

When inside, the first corridor leads both to a feasting area which is connected to a small kitchen with the other end of the corridor leading to sleeping quarters and barracks. A set of stairs leads up to jail cells that over look the river and are used for guests of a sort.

Next to this room is a library and study area, small slits in the stone walls cascading light over the dusty tombs that lie within and down the very end of the fortress lies the vault room which contains artifacts and weapons of heroes long dead.

boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A grand bastion stands, overlooking the misty forests below. Large stone pillars line the dirt path leading up to the great wooden engraved gates of the fortress, which are flanked by stone statues and murder holes.

Next to this room is a library and study area, small slits in the stone walls cascading light over the dusty tombs that lie within and down the very end of the fortress lies the vault room which contains artifacts and weapons of previous heroes which ran this fortress.

With time short you’ve had to reach out to contacts that may hold a specific ancient tome which you’ve been informed may contain a cure. Unfortunately however the only library who still holds this tome belongs to the city of High Pass and is under the private care of their military wing.

boardgame.name: Karako's Nest
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Tangled vines encircle the rocky cliff walls bringing with them small blossoming yellow flowers and lush foliage. Below them a creek slowing meanders through the gully passing ferns and boulders overgrown by the moss of ages. To either side of the gully grassy knolls lead deeper into the forest and toward an eroded cliff-side that has a stone staircase.

The staircase leads to an upper cliff-face where vines crisscross the gully having grown around the giant stones and holding others that have fallen from above in place. Cumbersome sticks scatter the ground and a large well crafted nest sits at the far side, holding within it three precious eggs.

Adventure Seed

On your way to the new world you become ship wrecked after an unexpected storm hits your vessel, recovering what gear you can find along the beach it becomes apparent that the only way forward is through the thick forested mountain passes as razor sharp reefs block access any further along the beach.

As you travel deeper the gnawing pain of hungry grows and you have no choice but to begin searching for new food sources. You first find strange sickly looking rodent scavengers which at the sight of you duck into the dense ferns and brambles but soon after a much tastier option avails itself.

While traveling along a small gully you hear the sounds of chirping coming from above and after finding an adequate way up the cliff face you come across a very large nest full of eggs and two new born bird creatures. Unfortunately It seems their mother has been watching you from close by...

boardgame.name: Ancient Forest Base Camp
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Tangled vines encircle the rocky cliff walls bringing with them small blossoming yellow flowers and lush foliage. Below them a creek meanders into the ocean and its sandy shore where a rowboat has been landed. A path leads deeper into the forest and toward an eroded cliff-side that has a stone staircase as well as several bridges which allow access to the other side of the small beach.

The staircase leads to an upper cliff-face where more wooden bridges have been set up in between the large rocky formations to reach an ideal camping ground.

boardgame.name: Moonlit Ancient Forest Base Camp
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Tangled vines encircle the rocky cliff walls bringing with them small blossoming yellow flowers and lush foliage. Below them a creek meanders into the ocean and its sandy shore where a rowboat has been landed. A path leads deeper into the forest and toward an eroded cliff-side that has a stone staircase as well as several bridges which allow access to the other side of the small beach.

The staircase leads to an upper cliff-face where more wooden bridges have been set up in between the large rocky formations to reach an ideal camping ground which glows with the campfires warmth.

boardgame.name: Party! Monster! Monster! Party!
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The weekend is finally here, and tonight is the BIG COSTUME PARTY at Silver & Gold - a club in the bad part of town that lets anyone in. The only problem is, you’ve heard that MONSTERS ARE PLANNING TO RUIN THE NIGHT!

That’s right, if being teenagers & surviving High School wasn’t tough enough, you also live in a town with a poorly disguised PORTAL TO HELL at its centre. Not everyone knows about the evil that seeps from the rotten core of Summertown, but you and your friends sure do. Most nights, you head out to hunt when other teenagers are just enjoying being kids.

Can you manage to enjoy just one party without it being ruined by FORCES FROM HELL?

PARTY! MONSTER! MONSTER! PARTY! is a mini RPG about fighting monsters, whilst trying to keep the party alive.

boardgame.name: Space Kittens
boardgame.description:
Space Kittens is a cooperative board game for 1-4 players from the creators of Alien Puppies. Colonize Kittengard without losing 9 lives. Each player is assigned a character that has unique abilities and powers to help you win the game.

Your objective is to colonize the planet by setting up five bases that consist of three elements - Dome, Cat Tree and Farm.

Set up:

Place the Board in the center of the table within easy reach of all the players.
Shuffle the Character cards and deal 1 to each player.
Shuffle Area Tiles FACE DOWN, draw 5 tiles and randomly put them FACE UP on the Board in the respective circles on Kittengard planet.
Separate the tokens by type (Domes, Cat Trees, Farm, Cat) and place them near the board in separate piles.
Place the Cat Token at at the bottom part of Lives section.
Shuffle the Environment Deck and place it FACE DOWN on the space indicated on the Board.
Shuffle the Resources Deck and deal 5 cards to each player, then place Resources Deck FACE DOWN on the space indicated on the Board. If any player has Distraction cards, return that card to the Resources Deck and give that player another card from the top of the deck. Then Re-shuffle the Resources Deck and put it FACE DOWN on the space indicated on the Board.

boardgame.name: The Hackers Handbook
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:


Hacking* in MOTHERSHIP® can be a lucrative, if dangerous, skill for any crewmember to acquire. It can open doors, control gun turrets and expose sensitive information.


Most *Hacking* checks are simple: an electronic airlock is locked and the Hacker makes an Intellect (*Hacking*) check and if they succeed the door is opened. Easy.

However, if your scenario requires a more robust challenge, say hacking into corporate research station’s primary database, you may want to design a **NETWORK**.

The Mothership Hacker's Handbook includes all the tools you need to create robust hacking challenges in Mothership or any other cyberpunk or sci-fi game. It includes:


A brand new loadout for character creation: The Exploitation Loadout.
Intuitive and simple rules and guidelines for building * Networks for your players to hack.
A Response table for when your players fail their hack.
A new system for "User Accounts" that allow everyone (not just Hackers) to get in on the action.
A new equipment section with tons of tools, decks, gear, and single-use software to aid in your intrusion attempts.


This supplement is suitable for characters of any level.

boardgame.name: Pew Pew! Bounty Hunters in Space
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Pew Pew! Bounty Hunters in Space is a one-shot tabletop RPG for up to seven players (and one GM). It uses the same system (lightly modified) from Havoc Brigade by Grant Howitt. Many thanks to Grant for graciously agreeing to let us do that. (If you haven't played Havoc Brigade - please check it out.)

It's a rules-light roleplaying game, with everything you need to play (aside from dice and friends).

It's light-hearted and intended for one shots; this isn't a story about deep-seated emotional turmoil and tortured introspection.

It's also great for new gamers, or playing online, because it's easy to pick up and quick to play.

It's a game about explosions and loads of big fights and ray guns and, maybe, maybe laser swords. It's an excellent game to run at conventions or as an emergency pick-up game, because all the prep is already done – it's baked into the system.

This is a game designed to tell one particular story: a rough and tumble bounty hunter squad tracking down a target in a sci-fi fantasy western setting.

Pew Pew! is built for speed. So all the characters are all pre-generated, so the GM should hand them out at the start of the session and the players can pick which ones they like. BUT - it's a simple system - so chargen is pretty easy. A blank character sheet is included.
boardgame.rpg: Pew Pew! Bounty Hunters in Space

boardgame.name: Tomb Punk
Tombpunk
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Adventuring is fun. Just don’t let the man get you down. Or the monsters. Or the forces of chaos.

Welcome to Tombpunk, a high-octane, high-action system with a rules-light approach. Jump into your adventure and brave a gritty world that doesn’t really want you to survive.

It’s a tough world out there. With a little luck—and a little help from your friends—you’ll survive.

boardgame.name: Utopia
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Utopia is a neo-futuristic roleplaying game, drawing on elements of cyberpunk and speculative science fiction. In Utopia, you will make some decisions about your setting, create a character with goals and ambitions and work to achieve those goals, while dealing with whatever challenges the world throws at you.

boardgame.name: Airship Admirals
boardgame.description:
Pick one of the 6 unique factions and lead them to victory in 2-4 player death-match. If you are unsure you can do it on your own create a temporary alliance.

You will move your Airship on a hexagon tile map and give orders to your crew in pursuit of victory. In total there are 4 unit classes with distinct capabilities in 6 stations. Every Airship and a unit in a class are unique! Weather elements change each turn and affect game dynamics. Turn based play with different phases for different types of actions. You will need swift movement and decisive attacks if you plan to survive. And one more thing, make sure to know your crew special abilities.

Your crew is on deck, eager to hear your first order Admiral!

—description from the designer
